comments:
Build F1

After debugging a plugin, accelerators stop working in the java source code 
editor. Switching back to the java perspective seems to reactivate them.
Cannot reproduce - do you have more detailed steps on how to make this happen?

Not really. I think it might have have something to do with the fact that the editor was maximized when starting the debug ... I'll try to investigate more on monday ... Anyway - during my last session it nearly happened always, so it has to be reproducable ...

Since I can't give you a better description on how to reproduce the problem, 
I'll try to explain exactly what happens...

First some infos:
I run Eclipse F1 with IBM JDK 1.3.0 (cn130-20010925). This JDK is also used 
for compiling, but for debugging I use Sun JDK 1.4.0-b92.

When I launch the Runtime Workbench, the process starts, then switches to 
suspended state for a very short time. While in suspended mode, the Editor 
opens open "Object.class" and the process continues to run. When I now switch 
back to my formerly opened editor, and try to make changes, I cannot use Ctrl-
S to save and CodeAssist (via Ctrl-Space) doesn't work either (just inserts a 
space)

In addition, I just realized that an exception was happening, so here is the 
stacktrace:
